snippet: More than 150 Egyptian police officers have been killed since mid-August alone, and the attacks have affected morale on the force.
abstract: Egypt has been growing increasingly dangerous for its police force in aftermath of ouster of Pres Mohamed Morsi, with over 150 officers killed since mid-August; officers, already poorly trained and equipped, have been pulled from regular details to oversee protests and resolve political confrontations for military-backed government; risk has been compounded by criticism police have received for using physical force against students.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAYY EL SHEIKH

lead_paragraph: More than 150 Egyptian police officers have been killed since mid-August alone, and the attacks have affected morale on the force.

headline.main: As Pressure Builds, Egypt’s Police Experience a New Feeling: Fear
headline.print_headline: As Pressure Builds, Egypt’s Police Experience a New Feeling: Fear

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
